Description: Rim sherd of Mature Animal Style Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed (fired reddish) below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: worn pattern band at rim above guilloche; below, bandof chequers with dotted blanks above vertical line and possible chequer.
Curator's comments: The rim pattern is consistent with the Wild Goat Style; Mature Animal Style rims are much simpler. However, the interior decoration is not typical of the Wild Goat Style, and so the sherd may mark the transition from Wild Goat Style to Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 262, no. 529)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1529) (phase 2)
